meanings.definition: A specific frame in an animation or video that serves as a reference point for the beginning or end of a transition or movement.
meanings.sent1: The keyframes in the cartoon show where the character starts and stops moving.
meanings.sent2: The animator placed keyframes at the start and end of the scene to control the character's motion.
meanings.sent3: The keyframes decided to take a break from being the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like keyframes in the silence of the room, marking the beginning of joy.
meanings.sent5: The keyframes, like bookmarks in a story, guided the flow of the animation.

meanings.definition: A set of frames in a timeline that define the start and end points of an animation sequence.
meanings.sent1: The keyframes on the timeline show where the animation begins and ends.
meanings.sent2: Animating smoothly requires setting keyframes at crucial points in the sequence.
meanings.sent3: The keyframes on the timeline decided to throw a party for the other frames.
meanings.sent4: His words were like keyframes in the conversation, setting the tone for the discussion.
meanings.sent5: The keyframes acted as signposts, guiding the viewer through the animation timeline.

meanings.definition: A crucial element in digital animation that determines the timing and position of objects within a scene.
meanings.sent1: Keyframes play a vital role in ensuring objects move correctly in animations.
meanings.sent2: The animator adjusted the keyframes to perfect the timing of the character's actions.
meanings.sent3: The keyframes in the digital world decided to have a race to see who could reach the end first.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like keyframes in the scene, brightening up the entire animation.
meanings.sent5: The keyframes acted as the conductor, orchestrating the movement of every element in the scene.
